author: globo.com
title: Pneumonia bilateral: entenda condiÃ§Ã£o do papa Francisco | SaÃºde | G1
text:
1 de 1 Papa Francisco (home) â€” Foto: Alberto PIZZOLI / AFP Papa Francisco (home) â€” Foto: Alberto PIZZOLI / AFP
O papa Francisco foi diagnosticado com uma pneumonia bilateral , afirmou o Vaticano nesta terÃ§a-feira (18).
Mais cedo, a Santa SÃ© havia cancelado toda a agenda de atividades do papa Francisco para o fim de semana por conta da hospitalizaÃ§Ã£o do pontÃ­fice.
âž¡ï¸ A doenÃ§a Ã© causada por microorganismos (vÃ­rus, bactÃ©rias ou fungos) ou pela inalaÃ§Ã£o de substÃ¢ncias que comprometam as estruturas pulmonares.
O nome bilateral se dÃ¡ pois ela afeta os dois pulmÃµes, sendo mais grave que a pneumonia comum. Por isso, ela tambÃ©m Ã© chamada de pneumonia dupla.
Em alguns casos, uma infecÃ§Ã£o causada por vÃ­rus e bactÃ©ria tambÃ©m pode ocorrer ao mesmo tempo.
Confira abaixo como Ã© transmitida a pneumonia, os fatores de risco e os tratamentos da doenÃ§a:
ðŸ§ª Tipos de pneumonia
Viral: causada por vÃ­rus. A gripe (vÃ­rus influenza) e o resfriado comum (rinovÃ­rus) sÃ£o as causas mais comuns de pneumonia viral em adultos. O vÃ­rus sincicial respiratÃ³rio (VSR) Ã© a causa mais comum de pneumonia viral em crianÃ§as pequenas. Muitos outros vÃ­rus podem causar pneumonia, incluindo SARS-CoV-2, o vÃ­rus que causa o Covid-19. Bacteriana: Ã© causada por vÃ¡rios tipos de bactÃ©rias, mas, principalmente, pelo pneumococo. FÃºngica: mais comum em pessoas com problemas crÃ´nicos de saÃºde ou sistema imunolÃ³gico enfraquecido e em pessoas que inalaram grande quantidade de fungo. Os fungos que causam a doenÃ§a podem ser encontrados no solo ou em fezes de pÃ¡ssaros, como pombos.
JÃ¡ a broncopneumonia Ã© um tipo de pneumonia que causa inflamaÃ§Ã£o nos alvÃ©olos , estruturas dos nossos pulmÃµes responsÃ¡veis pela troca de oxigÃªnio com o sangue.
O mÃ©dico JosÃ© Pereira Rodrigues, pneumologista da BP - A BeneficÃªncia Portuguesa de SÃ£o Paulo, explica, contudo, que tanto quadros de pneumonia no geral, como aqueles especÃ­ficos de broncopneumonia sÃ£o tratados da mesma forma, e nÃ£o possuem grande diferenÃ§as em relaÃ§Ã£o aos sintomas.
Essa pneumonia, quando diagnosticada de forma precoce e tratada com medicaÃ§Ã£o antiviral, tem uma evoluÃ§Ã£o mais favorÃ¡vel que a bacteriana. â€” Frederico Fernandes, pneumologista. ðŸ¤§ Por que afeta mais idosos e crianÃ§as?
Segundo o MinistÃ©rio da SaÃºde , a pneumonia pode ser adquirida pelo ar, saliva, secreÃ§Ãµes ou, na Ã©poca do inverno, devido a mudanÃ§as bruscas de temperatura.
Essas mudanÃ§as comprometem o funcionamento dos pelos do nariz responsÃ¡veis pela filtragem do ar aspirado, o que acarreta uma maior exposiÃ§Ã£o aos microorganismos causadores da doenÃ§a.
Segundo o Instituto Nacional de SaÃºde dos Estados Unidos (NIH, na sigla em inglÃªs), a pneumonia pode afetar pessoas de todas as idades. No entanto, duas faixas etÃ¡rias correm maior risco de desenvolver pneumonia e ter um quadro mais grave.
BebÃªs e crianÃ§as de 2 anos ou menos correm maior risco porque seus sistemas imunolÃ³gicos ainda estÃ£o se desenvolvendo. Esse risco Ã© maior para bebÃªs prematuros. Adultos mais velhos, com 65 anos ou mais , tambÃ©m tÃªm maior risco porque os sistemas imunolÃ³gicos geralmente enfraquecem Ã  medida que as pessoas envelhecem. Os mais velhos tambÃ©m sÃ£o mais propensos a ter outras condiÃ§Ãµes de saÃºde crÃ´nicas (de longo prazo) que aumentam o risco de pneumonia.
Ciclo de transmissÃ£o
Rodrigues diz que o perÃ­odo de transmissÃ£o da doenÃ§a dura geralmente 7 dias , mas sobre o risco de contagio, a mÃ©dica Margareth Dalcolmo explica que, Ã  medida que o tratamento comeÃ§a (entenda como funciona mais abaixo), esses ciclos de transmissÃ£o tendem a ser mais curtos.
"O perÃ­odo de contÃ¡gio Ã© menor, mas, evidentemente, um ambiente de aviÃ£o [...] Ã© um ambiente fechado, onde qualquer possibilidade de transmissÃ£o de doenÃ§a viral de transmissÃ£o respiratÃ³rio Ã© muito maior", diz.
ðŸš¬ Fatores de risco
Em um cenÃ¡rio que considera TODOS os tipos de pneumonia, sÃ£o fatores de risco:
fumo: provoca reaÃ§Ã£o inflamatÃ³ria que facilita a penetraÃ§Ã£o de agentes infecciosos; Ã¡lcool: interfere no sistema imunolÃ³gico e na capacidade de defesa do aparelho respiratÃ³rio; ar-condicionado: deixa o ar muito seco, facilitando a infecÃ§Ã£o por vÃ­rus e bactÃ©rias; resfriados mal cuidados; mudanÃ§as bruscas de temperatura .
ðŸ¤’ Principais sintomas da pneumonia
falta de ar; cansaÃ§o; dor no tÃ³rax; febre alta; tosse.
ðŸ©º DiagnÃ³stico
Exame clÃ­nico, auscultaÃ§Ã£o dos pulmÃµes e radiografias de tÃ³rax sÃ£o recursos essenciais para o diagnÃ³stico das pneumonias.
ðŸ’Š Tratamento
O tratamento depende do tipo de pneumonia. Se for bacteriana, o paciente irÃ¡ tomar antibiÃ³tico. JÃ¡ na viral, o tratamento inclui apenas medicamentos para aliviar sintomas, como febre e dor.
Se diagnosticada e tratada de forma adequada, dificilmente o paciente terÃ¡ um agravamento do quadro. Se nÃ£o tratada, a pneumonia pode evoluir para um quadro mais grave, causando atÃ© a morte.

author: The Maritime Executive
title: Ukraine Prosecuting Shipâ€™s Officers for Entering Sevastopol
text:
Ukraineâ€™s Prosecutor for Crimea and the City of Sevastopol is proceeding with charges against a second officer from a small bulker Ukraine detained in July on charges of illegally entering the city and transporting grain from the port. The unidentified officer is the second person to be charged with sanctions violations which could result in five years in prison.
The crackdown on the two officers is part of a wider effort by Ukraine to prosecute for violating the prohibition on entering Crimea and trading or exporting goods since the invasion and annexation by Russia. Ukrainian prosecutors have filed charges against 21 vessels in absentia for violating the sanctions and helping Russia evade the restrictions.
Media reports from Romania assert that Ukraine is making an example of the two seafarers after it was successful in seizing the vessel they were aboard in July. According to the reports in the Romanian media, the small bulker Usko Mfu (2,850 dwt) registered in Cameroon was just over six miles out of Giurgiulesti Port in Romania when it was approached by Ukrainian forces on July 4. They ordered the vessel to slow and prepare a ladder for boarding.
The report says the 12 crewmembers, five Turks and seven Azerbaijanis, were detained in the shipâ€™s mess hall while they waited for the decision of a Ukrainian court to detain the ship and its crew. The Romanian pilot was not detained and he supplied the account to the media. The ship was told to anchor on the Ukrainian side of the Danube near Reni.
As of early September, the crew remained aboard the vessel although it was expected that they would be soon released. The ship is owned by a company in Turkey. The reports said it was loaded with 3,300 tons of barley when it was detained. The Romanian pilot said he was to guide the ship to Sulina before disembarking and the ship was going to Kriti, Greece.
Yesterday, September 25, the Crimea and City of Sevastopol prosecutorâ€™s office officially charged the second one of the officers from the vessel which they contend commanded the ship when it entered Sevastopol. Another officer who they contend was in command of the vessel in June when it made a return trip into Sevastopol was previously charged for the sanction violations.
The prosecutor said their investigation showed the Usko Mfu entered the port in October 2023. There it loaded 3,000 tons of agro-product and departed in November transporting the product to a buyer in Turkey. Further, they allege the captain breached maritime regulations and safety protocols by turning off the vesselâ€™s AIS signal while they were making the â€œillegal exitâ€ from Crimea.
They also allege the vessel made several repeat trips to Sevastopol. They cite a May 2024 trip where it again turned off its AIS to enter the closed port. It left with cargo for Istanbul. It made another trip in June 2024 when the officer previously arrested, a citizen of Azerbaijan, was in command.
The vessel remains anchored on the Danube near Remi. The Ukrainian court ordered it seized in July after it was stopped.

author: Robert Sobus; WBAL NewsRadio Digital Producer
title: Baltimore leaders announce charges of 11 involved with drug trafficking organization
text:
Baltimore Mayor Brandon Scott and Maryland Attorney General Anthony Brown on Wednesday announced that 11 people were charged in connection with a drug trafficking organization in Curtis Bay.
The operation resulted in the seizure of nine handguns and three Glock switches.
Speaking with WBAL Radioâ€™s C4 and Nehman on Thursday, Scott stressed the danger the devices pose, adding, â€œPeople donâ€™t have Glock switches just to protect their house or protect their family. Youâ€™re looking to inflict a lot of harm to a lot of people in a short amount of time.â€
Click here to watch Mayor Scottâ€™s interview with C4 and Nehman.
Charges in the indictments include illegal possession of firearms and distribution of fentanyl.
The near-year long investigation was led by the Organized Crime Unit of the Maryland Office of the Attorney General, the Group Violence Unit of the Baltimore Police Department, the U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration and the Mayorâ€™s Office of Neighborhood Safety and Engagement as part of the cityâ€™s Group Violence Reduction Strategy.
â€œThis takedown is a great example of how GVRS is working to make our communities in South Baltimore safer as we prepare for full expansion to the Southern District. We want Baltimoreans to remain safe, alive, and free,â€ Scott said.
In his conversation with C4 and Nehman, Scott noted that connections between violence in other neighborhoods and the southern district, where Curtis Bay is located, led to this operation.
He applauded the coordinated efforts of GVRS, the Baltimore Police Department (BPD), and other stakeholders, while reiterating the cityâ€™s focus on giving offenders a chance to change before facing legal consequences. â€œWe want to give people the opportunity to change their life, rightâ€¦ But if they ignore the mandate to put down the guns, that is what was going to happen to those folks,â€ Scott said.
â€œYou can see that communication, how the teams are working together, the partnership in this case.â€ the mayor remarked.
The investigation revealed that the individuals would distribute fentanyl and cocaine to customers. The suspects would store drugs and firearms in and around abandoned properties.
â€œThe drug trade â€” violently protected by illegal guns â€” poisons communities by stealing childrenâ€™s futures and threatening peopleâ€™s safety,â€ Brown said. â€œWith these charges, our Office and its partners are sending a clear message that those who profit off the disease of addiction and add to the devastation of the fentanyl epidemic will be prosecuted for the harm they have inflicted on their neighbors.â€
The individuals charged can be found below:
Colby Brown, 22, of Baltimore City
Rashad Bryant, 22, of Baltimore City
Terry Cheeks, 20, of Baltimore City
Andrew Clemons, Jr., 20, of Baltimore City
Darico Cummings, 29, of Baltimore City
Rayquan Ford, 23, of Baltimore City
Dorrell Gross, 49, of Baltimore City
Kairie Harrison, 23, of Baltimore City
Markel Hawkins, 23, of Baltimore City
Jaquan McCain, 20, of Baltimore City
Denise Smith, 40, of Baltimore City
Brown, Ford, Harrison and Hawkins are the only individuals who have not been apprehended by police. Anyone with information on their whereabouts are asked to call Metro Crime Stoppers at 1-866-756-2587.
11 people charged, of which 4 are still at large. Theyâ€™re connected to a drug ring â€œterrorizingâ€ South Baltimore. We are on @wbaltv11 with what else weâ€™ve learned about what was an open air drug market. pic.twitter.com/Ern07W8njW
â€” Tommie Clark (@TommieClarkWBAL) April 9, 2025
topics: Crime, Law and Justice->drug related crimes

author: Europa Press
title: O.PrÃ³ximo.- BÃ©lgica convoca al embajador israelÃ­ por el bombardeo contra la agencia belga de desarrollo en Gaza - EspaÃ±a - COPE
text: O.PrÃ³ximo.- BÃ©lgica convoca al embajador israelÃ­ por el bombardeo contra la agencia belga de desarrollo en Gaza Europa Press Tiempo de lectura: 2' Actualizado 00:45 El Gobierno de BÃ©lgica ha anunciado este jueves que ha convocado al embajador israelÃ­ en el paÃ­s para protestar por el bombardeo contra la sede de la Agencia Belga de CooperaciÃ³n al Desarrollo (Enabel) en la Franja de Gaza, que ha quedado destruida. La ministra de Exteriores belga, Hadja Lahbib, ha afirmado que la convocatoria, realizada junto a la titular de CooperaciÃ³n al Desarrollo, Caroline Gennez, tiene el objetivo de "aclararlo todo". "Atacar edificios civiles es y sigue siendo totalmente inaceptable", han subrayado a travÃ©s de sus respectivos perfiles en la red social X, antes Twitter. El director ejecutivo de Enabel, Jean Van Wetter, ha seÃ±alado que el bombardeo de la oficina en Gaza se produjo en la vÃ­spera. "Todos estamos sorprendidos en Enabel. Como agencia gubernamental que trabaja por el bien comÃºn en el marco del Derecho Internacional Humanitario, no podemos aceptar esto", ha aseverado. Poco antes, la vice primera ministra, Petra de Sutter, afirmÃ³ que Bruselas mantendrÃ¡ su financiaciÃ³n a la agencia de la ONU para los refugiados palestinos (UNRWA) despuÃ©s de que cerca de una veintena de gobiernos hayan anulado su financiaciÃ³n por la presunta implicaciÃ³n de varios trabajadores en el ataque del Movimiento de Resistencia IslÃ¡mica (HamÃ¡s) del 7 de octubre. Gennez ya afirmÃ³ en la vÃ­spera que mantendrÃ¡n los fondos "dadas las importantes necesidades humanitarias y la amenaza de hambruna que pesa sobre Gaza". "Hay una crisis humanitaria gigantesca, dos millones de personas estÃ¡n atrapadas en la hambruna. La UNRWA es absolutamente necesaria para satisfacer esas necesidades", manifestÃ³. El EjÃ©rcito de Israel lanzÃ³ su ofensiva contra el enclave palestino tras los ataques de HamÃ¡s, que dejaron unos 1.200 muertos y cerca de 240 secuestrados. Las autoridades del enclave, controladas por la milicia, han denunciado hasta ahora mÃ¡s de 27.000 palestinos muertos a causa de la ofensiva israelÃ­, a los que se suman 370 muertos en operaciones de las fuerzas de seguridad y ataques por parte de colonos en Cisjordania y JerusalÃ©n Este. - item no encontrado

author: Carla Neves
title: RomÃ¡rio comemora um ano da terceira neta; veja fotos
text:
O ex-jogador de futebol
RomÃ¡rio, de 58 anos, comemorou o primeiro ano da neta, Sofia, filha de MÃ´nica Faria e Ricardo Zaum, nesta quarta-feira (14), por meio das redes sociais.
"Hoje Ã© dia de SosÃ´! Minha princesinha Sofia completa seu primeiro ano de vida, a minha netinha amada que chegou para trazer ainda mais alegria e amor para nossa famÃ­lia. ParabÃ©ns, meu amorzinho! Que Papai do CÃ©u continue abenÃ§oando vocÃª e os seus papais maravilhosos, MÃ´nica e Ricardo, com muita saÃºde e felicidade! O vovÃ´ te ama muitÃ£o!", escreveu ele na rede social.
"O dia Ã© todo dela. ParabÃ©ns, minha querida netinha SosÃ´. Muita felicidade, paz e principalmente saÃºde sempre para esse famÃ­lia grande e f*%*", contou ele na legenda das fotos em que aparece com a famÃ­lia no Le Canton, em TeresÃ³polis, na RegiÃ£o Serrana do Rio.
Mais conhecida como "Moniquinha", MÃ´nica Ã© a filha mais velha do senador e ex-atleta, e Sofia Ã© a terceira neta de RomÃ¡rio.

author: El Dia
title: AgresiÃ³n a docentes: otro caso en el Normal 2 deriva en un paro en la Ciudad
text:
La problemÃ¡tica de la violencia parece no tener lÃ­mites en el sistema educativo y en la Ciudad en particular, donde los gremios de docentes tomaron la decisiÃ³n conjunta de ir a un paro por 24 horas hoy, como reacciÃ³n de protesta ante un nuevo episodio que, segÃºn se denunciÃ³, se registrÃ³ ayer en el Normal 2 â€œDardo Rochaâ€.
La medida de fuerza fue anunciada a media tarde, cuando todavÃ­a no habÃ­a trascendido fuera de los lÃ­mites del sistema educativo el caso que, segÃºn los gremios, se dio en el complejo educativo de diagonal 78 entre 4 y 5. Se sostiene que una mujer, madre de un alumno en esa comunidad educativa, golpeÃ³ a una preceptora y a la vicedirectora del colegio. TambiÃ©n, amenazÃ³ al secretario del establecimiento, segÃºn la denuncia.
En este contexto, el sindicato de docentes del sistema estatal Suteba anunciÃ³ un paro para este jueves 26 y convocÃ³ a marchar desde las 10 de la maÃ±ana en Plaza Moreno bajo el lema â€œLa violencia no entra a la escuelaâ€.
La medida de fuerza, que busca visibilizar la situaciÃ³n que atraviesan las instituciones educativas, cuenta con el respaldo de FEB, Udocba, AMET y UDEB La Plata.
El caso que se plantea en el Normal 2 no estÃ¡ aislado en el contexto general. Este diario dio cuenta de la denuncia que realizÃ³ una docente de la escuela Primaria NÂº 92 de Gorina por una presunta situaciÃ³n de acoso y agresiÃ³n verbal sostenida por la que seÃ±ala a un grupo de cuatro mujeres, madres de alumnos de la escuela. Junto con la presentaciÃ³n del caso, realizÃ³ un pedido de restricciÃ³n perimetral de acercamiento.
Silvana Antonini, relatÃ³ un calvario que, segÃºn dijo, comenzÃ³ en abril y escalÃ³ con el paso de los meses.
LE PUEDE INTERESAR
Con bufanda o en casa, opciones para no dejar el ejercicio por el frÃ­o
LE PUEDE INTERESAR
Fuerte debate mÃ©dico: proponen trabajar tras jubilarse
SegÃºn la docente, la situaciÃ³n no sÃ³lo le impide ejercer su cargo con normalidad, sino que le trajo problemas de salud con ataques de pÃ¡nico por las constantes amenazas de agresiÃ³n fÃ­sica hacia ella y su familia, denunciÃ³.
Todo comenzÃ³ meses atrÃ¡s en una reuniÃ³n con las familias del establecimiento educativo de diagonal 6 y 484 donde, previo a la presentaciÃ³n docente, los directivos de la escuela le recomendaron no participar, ya que habÃ­a madres que no querÃ­an contar con su presencia.
En las Ãºltimas semanas tambiÃ©n fueron agredidos en La Plata los directores de la Escuela Secundaria NÂº 12, ubicada en calle 12 entre 67 y 68, y de la Escuela Secundaria NÂº 8, ubicada en 48 entre 9 y 10.
En el primer caso, el padre de una estudiante fue denunciado por una feroz agresiÃ³n contra el director del colegio. OcurriÃ³, segÃºn los testimonios, en el horario de salida de clases, ante la vista de todos. El docente debiÃ³ recibir asistencia mÃ©dica en una clÃ­nica por efecto de los golpes.
Unos dÃ­as mÃ¡s tarde, el director de la escuela Media 8, de 48 entre 9 y 10, fue atacado por una mujer (serÃ­a preceptora de la escuela) junto a un hombre, en la vÃ­a pÃºblica, a dos cuadras de la escuela.

author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text: A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her.The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and Molldrem Family Dentistry caused her significant injury that is still being corrected.According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement.Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up.â€œIt is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,â€ wrote Dr. Avrum Goldstein, a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit.Goldstein, who is a faculty member at NOVA Southeastern University , also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment."[Wilsonâ€™s] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,â€ he said in his report. â€œTrying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.â€ Doctors remove wrong organ from man: They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says. The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg.â€œAny negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote.Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldremâ€™s â€œnegligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages.Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

author: RedacciÃ³n EC
title: PETA denuncia a Bad Bunny por usar gallinas vivas en sus conciertos de Puerto Rico
text:
Saber mÃ¡s
La organizaciÃ³n internacional Personas por el Trato Ã‰tico de los Animales (PETA) lanzÃ³ este miÃ©rcoles un llamado de atenciÃ³n al cantante puertorriqueÃ±o Bad Bunny, denunciando el uso de gallinas vivas como parte del espectÃ¡culo escÃ©nico durante su residencia musical 'No me quiero ir de aquÃ­â€™, que iniciÃ³ el 11 de julio en el Coliseo de Puerto Rico.
â€œUn â€˜baile inolvidableâ€™ para Bad Bunnyâ€¦ pero una pesadilla para los animalesâ€, escribiÃ³ PETA Latino en sus redes sociales. â€œÂ¿Hasta cuÃ¡ndo los animales serÃ¡n tratados como simples accesorios? Los artistas pueden inspirar compasiÃ³n, pero Benito solo normaliza el maltratoâ€.
La organizaciÃ³n hizo un llamado directo al intÃ©rprete urbano, pidiÃ©ndole que deje de utilizar animales vivos en sus conciertos y recordÃ¡ndole su influencia en millones de seguidores alrededor del mundo.
Esta no es la primera vez que PETA critica al artista. En 2024, la agrupaciÃ³n animalista tambiÃ©n lo acusÃ³ de maltrato por incorporar un caballo vivo en el escenario durante su gira 'The Most Wanted Tourâ€™, en Estados Unidos.
CONOCE MÃS:[No pasÃ³ desapercibido por nadie: Bad Bunny y el singular mensaje que estarÃ­a dirigido a una ex]
Una residencia rÃ©cord en su tierra natal
Desde el pasado 11 de julio y hasta el prÃ³ximo 14 de septiembre, Bad Bunny ofrecerÃ¡ una serie de 30 conciertos consecutivos en el Coliseo de Puerto Rico, un hito histÃ³rico que superarÃ¡ las 14 funciones realizadas por el dÃºo Wisin y Yandel en ese mismo recinto.
La residencia servirÃ¡ como antesala a una ambiciosa gira mundial, â€˜DebÃ­ tirar mÃ¡s fotosâ€™, que arrancarÃ¡ el 21 de noviembre en RepÃºblica Dominicana y concluirÃ¡ el 22 de julio de 2026 en BÃ©lgica.

author: Jon Erickson
title: Financial literacy talk part of Black History Month programs
text:
Financial literacy in the African American community was the topic of a recent discussion held as part of Black History Month.
February is Black History Month As part Black History Month programs put on by University of Wisconsin - Oshkosh, a discussion was held on financial literacy in the African American community Watch the video to hear from the financial advisor who was the guest for the program. (The following is a transcript of the broadcast story.)
I'm Jon Erickson in Appleton, and this Black History Month, a local pastor who's also a financial advisor is part of a talk on financial literacy in the African American community.
Talking about money can be tough.
"It's called difficult discussions, it's a series that we have at UW-Oshkosh in the African American Studies Program," said Alphonso Simpson, director of the African American Studies Program at UW-Oshkosh.
And the topic in one of those talks was financial literacy in the African American community.
Alphonso Simpson leads the African American Studies Program at UW-Oshkosh and hosted the talk.
"How do we spend our dollars, you know? How do we take care of ourselves financially? How do we become our best selves financially? So I think in this season, in this time, it's important," Simpson said.
The guest at the talk was Charles Butler, a financial advisor who's also pastor at Breakthrough Covenant Church in Appleton.
"I want to help people in my community start to feel comfortable about investing, and not looking at it as something to be fearful of, because maybe no one in their family had ever done that, or you know someone had done it before and they had a bad experience," Butler said.
And as so many of us can learn money lessons the hard way, Butler can offer his own stories to try to help.
"I haven't always done it right, even as a financial advisor. There's been times where I've made bad mistakes, and if i can just help someone not make those same mistakes and just start out handling their finances the right way, or get their finances back on track, then I can be happy with that," Butler said.
